meanings.definition: A photograph made by a process in which an image is produced on a light-sensitive metallic plate.
meanings.sent1: The ferrotype captured a moment in time on a shiny metal plate.
meanings.sent2: I saw a beautiful ferrotype of a flower at the art gallery.
meanings.sent3: The ferrotype of the cat looked like it was posing for the camera.
meanings.sent4: Her smile in the ferrotype shone like a polished mirror.
meanings.sent5: The ferrotype revealed intricate details with a metallic sheen.

meanings.definition: To produce a photograph using the ferrotype process.
meanings.sent1: She learned how to ferrotype her favorite landscapes.
meanings.sent2: Photographers used to ferrotype portraits in the 19th century.
meanings.sent3: I will ferrotype our group photo for the yearbook.
meanings.sent4: His skill in ferrotyping images made him stand out among photographers.
meanings.sent5: Ferrotyping requires precision and attention to detail.
